result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad R Seltzner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad R Seltzner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad R Seltzner was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED & STAYED. Consec to 13CF2434.
6/26/18 Crt orders def is eligible for Substance Abuse Program but NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. All other conditions remain the same.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Successful completion of drug court.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

5/2/16 Crt signed Order. Joint & Several.   To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
